section.p: Sends data stream messages to all users in a channel. Up to 30 packets can be sent per second in a channel with each packet having a maximum size of 1 kB. Each client can send up to 6 kB of data per second. Each user can have up to five data streams simultaneously.

After successfully calling this method, the remote end will trigger a callback, and the remote user can get the received stream message in this callback; if the call fails, the remote end will trigger the callback.

ul.li: Please make sure that the data channel has been created before calling this method.
In the `LIVE_BROADCASTING` profile, only a host can call this method.

plentry.pd: The configurations for the data stream. It can be obtained through.
Occurs each time the SDK receives a video frame sent by the remote user.
